summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding a defense filing in the Epstein case. The defense explains Epstein's possession of an expired Austrian passport from the 1980s, claiming it was for personal protection during travel to dangerous areas.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the defense filing; his possession and explanation of an expired Austrian passport is discussed.

events.title: Acquisition of Austrian Passport
events.description: Epstein acquired an Austrian passport in the 1980s, which the defense claims was for personal protection during travel to dangerous areas due to prevalent hijackings.

keyFacts: Epstein possessed an Austrian passport that expired 32 years prior to 2019 (around 1987).
The defense claims the passport was acquired in the 1980s for personal protection during travel to dangerous areas, specifically due to hijackings and Middle East travel risks.
The defense argues there is no evidence Epstein ever used the passport.
The document is an internal email between prosecutors discussing a defense filing regarding the passport issue.
